title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
This board had little liquid damage, and its not turning on, 
ppbus_g3h = 12.6
PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU = 3,3
PP1V2_S3 = 0
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 0
PP5V_G3S = 5,13
PP1V5R1V35_S0_GPU_MEM = 0
PPVCORE_S0_GPU = 0
CPU_PWRGD = 0
PMU_ONOFF_R_L = 1,3 
PM_SYSRST_L = 0
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK = 0
PM_PCH_PWROK = 0
PLT_RST_L = 0
PM_RSMRST_L =  3,3
SMC_SYSRST_L = 0
PVCCIO_EN = 0

don´t know where to start... if I force DFU mode injecting 3v, it stays in 5v, is that normal?

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
The board should enter DFU, if you get all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages.
It will stay on 5V at USB-C input then, as normal.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: I was able to access it in DFU mode, the firmware was restored correctly, but never saw image on the screen, then tried to connect it to a external hdmi screen but it´s not turning on... can you please tell me which voltages are needed on the power sequence in that model? Thank you!

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: Check if you get voltage on the big coils; RAM, PCH, CPU, etc...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
I dont get voltages on big coils exept for: L7030 and L7660
PP1V05_S0SW is not present on the PMU  I get all the voltages but that one and I´m not sure but it seems to be created in U7800 is that right?

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
If you post so ambigous information, I cannot help  :(.
You are telling to NOT get coils voltage, except two, and next line you say to get ALL VOLTAGES.
What should I understand, or how???

Which are these "all voltages" you get on the board?
If you don't get voltage on more coils than L7030/660, why would you look for an S0 voltage?

Trigger PMU_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L (at same time).
Use SWK000/2 pads, instead of power button.
Do the same with PM_SLP_S3_L.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: sorry: PP1V05_S0SW is not present on the PMU I get all PMU voltages but that one and I´m not sure but it seems to be created in U7800 is that right?

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
Tried triggering PMU_ONOFF_L 
PM_SLP_S3_L = 0
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0

on my usb c voltage meter when I connect the computer i get this 
5v transition to 20v with a .200 Amp consumption for 2 seconds then drops to 30 miliamps...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
Did you try SMC bypass?
If is not a SMC sensor issue, then may have a short in a secondary power supply.

I hope you'checked the mentioned reactions at same time when triggering PMU_ONOFF_L.
BTW, PMU_ONOFF_L stays high normally?

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
I checked the reactions when connecting the usb c charger on both rails no pulse or voltage I checked them shorting PMU_ONOFF_L to ground and no pulse or voltage came out of those lines. PMU_ONOFF_L is high at 3.3v

I will try to bypass smc, just don´t know how to do it in this models...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: Ok, i just tried SMC bypass and It just doesnt do anything... its the same behavior goes to 200 mAmps then drops to 30 mAmps...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: Please help me understand what´s happening with this board... it is apparently trying to start but when I connect it to the USB C meter it gets to 5v @120-240 mAmps then makes the transition to 20.1v @200mAmps top and drops to 30mAmps. I think there is something wrong when it is at 5v. It shouldn´t take that high amperage at 5v, correct? Please Help me I am so stuck with this board!

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
The problem appears when the board switches to 20V.
It tries to start and probably short on a secondary power supply is detected.
Check for pulse at all big coils, when connect the charger; at the same moment when switches 5-20V.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: The only 2 coils that get some voltage and have correct values are L7030 and L7660 no other coil pulses I even checked with an osciloscope and I get nothing... don´t know what to do...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
You may have a problem with PCH.
Check the power on sequence.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oBr-qxYVfghYimgX6pwkNbwSjpQfYbKq/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iYu7bOpqinZlWN18qHIKFDXvkSM2dk8O/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: I didn´t had PVDDQ_EN so I reballed U7800 just in case... the board turned on, I connected it into the case... it showed the apple and question mark folder... now I am trying to turn it on again but it won´t. It´s stuck at 5v @250-450mAmps

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
Where was the liquid spilled?
You should have something corroded still.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: The corroded area is aroud U3000, u3500.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: Check/replace capacitors in that area.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: All capacitors are good, replaced a couple of them, but no difference... Still not getting PVCCIO_EN and already changed U7800 this is driving me crazy... what voltages are requiered on U7800 for it to create that line?

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
Did you try the board again on the desk?
Like the last time turned on...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: Yes.. with the battery connected if power button pressed for a few seconds it turns on but its laggy and show the question mark folder, tried internet recovery but couldn´t complete... without the battery on my bench it just keeps stuck at 20v @40mAmps

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: Try DFU restore with battery connected.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: I tried it again and was able to restore, but nothing shows on the screen. There is a weird thing... when the restore finishes, instead of having DFU icon it shows a lock... this board is driving me crazy! I don´t get why it lets me access it in DFU but won´t turn on...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: You've said turns on, with question mark folder.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
It did... with the battery I had to keep pressed the power button (then pressed it many times) and it turned on, but it did it 2 times, then it stopped turning on...
is ppbus_g3h at 12.6 normal on this model?

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
So restored the firmware again... it finished doing the installation, the computer showed the folder with question mark and suddenly turned off.
Now if I press the power button the fan spins, but there is no image on the screen... U1200 is getting very hot... should I reball that one?
update: I reflowed U1200, now I´m getting 20v @650mAmps. no image on screen... do you think that is a step forward?

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
You can try changing the PCH.
DFU restore must be done again after that.

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: Don´t have a donor board for that model, anything that can be done? U1200 is heating up to 50ºC power button now turns on and off the fans, but brain dead... anything else I can do? I enter DFU again and restored it, still getting 650mAmps and no image... what do you think happened? It was the PCH all the way ?? Did I killed it? I didn´t inject any voltage or anytthing...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: No need donor board, get new PCH...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message: where? I have looked online with the part number [B]CNL-PCH-H-USFF-QNYP 961822,[/B] nothing comes up...

title: 820-01041-A  NO POWER
message:
It should have the classic SRxxx code printed.
Be aware, may require a lot of patience to find it.
